Product description

Product Description

TSP ALL PURPOSE HEAVY DUTY CLEANER - This heavy duty, nonsudsing Trisodium Phosphate compound is the ideal cleaner for tough jobs. Preferred by painting and cleaning professionals for removing heavy deposits of greasy grime, smoke and soot stains from walls, woodwork and floors.

From the Manufacturer

A non-sudsing powdered Trisodium Phosphate compound that is formulated for heavy duty cleaning. Preferred by painting and cleaning professionals for removing heavy deposits of greasy grime, smoke, soot stains and chalked paint from walls, woodwork and floors. Removes mildew and mildew stains when mixed with bleach. Also recommended for washing away paint remover sludge.

Important Note: Store in an area that is cool and dry. Moisture can cause caking.

Purgandi Dracointerfectorem
5.0 out of 5 starsGood-bye mold, mildew, nasty build-up, etc.
November 17, 2016
Verified Purchase
I live in an area where the mold count can get pretty high, and sometimes the humidity doesn't quit. If the dehumidifier dies (and eventually it will), you've got trouble. Mold trouble. The homes are also nearly 50 years old, too. A friend of mine gutted her home. I can't even tell you what she spent to re-do everything, even the kitchen. I went a different direction. I bought this, combined it with the washing soda from the laundry, and in just one day we had everything all cleaned up. We used 1% TSP and 5% washing soda, in water. The attic, crawl spaces and basement were all fogged (15 minutes for each area). It is important to use a respirator, safety goggles, and cover your clothing, too. We rented a serious fogger- well worth the small investment vs. buying something cheap. We also used this to wash down other things. Roof and siding lost those nasty mold streaks. All of the musty smells are gone. The wood beams even lost their dark and dirty look. Fantastic!

We've been on a roll. The inside of the washing machine would have to be washed with detergent, as soil gradually builds up in it (I KNOW! We do use enough detergent, and boosters, too, in our state the available detergents leave behind that dirt, though). The dishwasher was becoming less and less effective with the build-up in there, too. I did regular vinegar treatments, and that breaks down some things. A little touch of TSP and the dishwasher is working great again.

This is a powerful chemical. You need to use precautions, handle and store this safely. If I had children in the home, less elderly pets (mine only sleep these days), or anybody with poor judgment, then I would just use this all at once and then get it out of my house. Those are not concerns, so I get to keep it, yay! It is inexpensive enough not to take any unnecessary risks, though, and it is available in smaller quantities, too.

I purchased this at full retail- no discounts or sales. This review is based upon my own experience and is my personal evaluation. I'm a repeat customer, with no other relationship, interest, blog or profit in the sale of this item. I am extremely thankful. I may not have a new kitchen and entirely new house inside, but that was never going to happen. This saved my house, my appliances, my garage, my shed, and lots of stuff inside, too. Happy, happy!

Network Doctor
5.0 out of 5 starsLaundry Champ
November 7, 2017
Verified Purchase
I love this product for the laundry, because the modern phosphate-free detergents flat-out don't get clothes clean, like the old phosphate-boosted detergents did years ago. Modern laundry soap is loaded with fragrance to cover the smell of odors and dirt they are unable to completely remove. Add about 1/4 cup of TSP to each load-- a little more if you're doing a grungy load. Over time colors, and whites-turned-gray, do regain some brightness, and new whites stay white. Yes, the product gets lumpy when it absorbs ambient moisture, but it crumbles back into powder very easily. I grab a small chunk and break it apart in my hand while sprinkling around as the washer fills, and it quickly dissolves as soon as it hits the water.

JR
2.0 out of 5 starsGood product with horrible packaging. Buy the DAP brand instead. More expensive but the superior packaging is worth it.
February 4, 2018
Verified Purchase
This is a good product with horrible packaging. I have ordered it from Amazon many times and most of the time it arrives hard as a rock or with the packaging actually torn open or crumbling. This is a result of the tendency of TSP to aggressively absorb moisture from the air. Some of this problem is the way Amazon stores, packs and ships the product but most of the problem is a direct consequence of very poor packaging by the manufacturer.

In any event, the DAP brand is worth the extra cost. The packaging is a wax carton (like a milk carton) that keeps the TSP as a powder.
